detaileddescription.para: The granularity of simulation time. Default is MICROSECONDS.
The reference time unit specifying what is meant by the simulation time step of 1 in statements without an explicit declaration of a time unit like in new TimeSpan(5).
The point in simulation time when the experiment has started.
The TimeFormatter to use for printing TimeInstants in this environment.
Flag to indicate that a user-defined TimeFormatter is used (true), while false means the default is applied.

Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the sum of the given TimeSpan objects. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting sum is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the sum of the TimeSpan parameters

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new Time Instant determined from the instant passed to this method plus the time span passed to method. In other words, this method determines the instant that is a given span after the instant provided. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting instant is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon). The preferred time zone of the result is equal to the preferred time zone of parameter b.

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeInstant determined from given TimeInstant plus the given TimeSpan

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new Time Instant determined from the instant passed to this method plus the time span passed to method. In other words, this method determines the instant that is a given span after the instant provided. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting instant is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon). The preferred time zone of the result is equal to the preferred time zone of instant passed to this method.

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeInstant determined from given TimeInstant plus the given TimeSpan

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new Time Instant determined from the instant passed to this method minus the time span passed to method. In other words, this method determines the instant that is a given span before the instant provided. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting instant is smaller than 0 (in the unit of epsilon). The preferred time zone of the result is equal to the preferred time zone of instant passed to this method.

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeInstant determined from given TimeInstant minus the given TimeSpan

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the absolute difference of the given TimeSpan objects.

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the absolute difference of the TimeSpan parameters

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the absolute difference of the given TimeInstant objects, i.e. the span of time between the two instants of time. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting sum is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the difference of the TimeSpan parameters

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the product of the given TimeSpan and the factor of type double. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting product is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the product of span and factor

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the product of the given TimeSpan and the factor of type double. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting product is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the product of span and factor

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the quotient of the given TimeSpan objects.

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the quotient of dividend and divisor

detaileddescription.para: Returns a new TimeSpan object representing the quotient of the given TimeSpan and the divisor of type double. Note that the simulation will stop immediately if the resulting quotient is larger than Long.MAX_VALUE-1 (in the unit of epsilon).

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : A new TimeSpan as the quotient of divident and divisor

detaileddescription.para: Returns the epsilon value representing the granularity of simulation time for this experiment.

simplesect.para: TimeUnit : The granularity of simulation time

detaileddescription.para: Returns the smallest distinguishable TimeSpan.

simplesect.para: TimeSpan : The smallest distinguishable TimeSpan, i.e. one interval of the epsilon unit

detaileddescription.para: Returns the time Formatter. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.
Returns the TimeInstant when the experiment has started.

simplesect.para: TimeInstant : The point in simulation time, the experiment has started.

detaileddescription.para: Returns the reference time unit specifying what is meant by the simulation time step of 1 in statements without an explicit declaration of a time unit like in new TimeSpan(5).
Sets the epsilon value representing the granularity of simulation time to the given TimeUnit parameter. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.

parameterdescription.para: TimeUnit : The granularity of simulation time, i.e. the smallest distinguishable span of simulation time.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the reference time unit specifying what is meant by the simulation time step of 1 in statements without an explicit declaration of a time unit like in new TimeSpan(5). This is a package private method for internal framework use only.
Formats the given instant of time according to the timeFormatter. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.

parameterdescription.para: the instant of time to be formatted

detaileddescription.para: Formats the given span of time according to the timeFormatter. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.

parameterdescription.para: the span of time to be formatted

detaileddescription.para: Sets the time Formatter. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.

parameterdescription.para: indicates that a user-defined TimeFormatter is supplied (true) or a default TimeFormatter is assigned (false). Default TimeFormatters (e.g. as set up when an Experiment object is created) will not overwrite a TimeFormatter potentially previously set the the user by calling Experiment.setTimeFormatter(...).

detaileddescription.para: Sets the TimeFormatter used by this environment to a SingleUnitTimeFormatter, using the current reference unit and four floating point digits. This is a package private method for internal framework use only.

TimeOperations is an utility class that provides arithmetic operations for the time classes TimeInstant and TimeSpan. It also holds the time settings, i.e. the granularity (epsilon) and the reference time unit.
